page.title: 09The Burghley Horse Trials.
page.content: The Burghley Horse Trials,held yearly,started in 1961 and are now sponsored by Remy Martin,a French Brandy firm.Any money raised is given to the British Horse Society.In 1984 costs were Â£250,000 but new building will increase the cost this year.The European Horse Trials held every three years,and won 1971 by Princess Anne,takes place here each time a British competitor wins. Captain Mark Phillips won the Bughley Horse Trials in 1973.This year it is expected that 80-90 competitors from 12 countries will compete.Visitors will pay Â£5 per car, pedestrians Â£2 (Saturday Â£12 and Â£3) 160,000 people visited last year. The dressage test takes two days,then one day cross-country and the final day is show-jumping.Refreshments are availble and over 200 stalls provide the public with a great range of goods
